data.title: FAQs
data.meta_description: Find information about birth certificates from how to request a copy of a birth certificate to where we get birth information before it's recorded.
data.text:
Please contact the California Department of Public Health for assistance. www.cdph.ca.gov – (916) 445-2684. Search “Add Parent on a Birth Certificate.” Visit this link for more information on the process: https://www.cdph.ca.gov/Programs/CHSI/Pages/Adjudication-of-Facts-of-Parentage.aspx

Amendments to birth records are handled by the California Department of Public Health. Please visit their website for assistance on amending a record. Visit www.cdph.ca.gov. Search “amend birth record.” Call (916) 445-2684.

After birth registration, most birth certificates are available after 10 days from the Los Angeles County Department of Public Health. Please contact that office for these rush certificates. Call (213) 288-7812. Visit: http://www.ph.lacounty.gov/dca/dcabirth.htm. The birth certificate is available with this office after two months.

The child must first be registered with the local health department. Please contact the Los Angeles County Department of Public Health (DPH Vital Records Office) located at 313 North Figueroa Street, Room Lobby-1, Los Angeles, CA 90012. For questions, call (213) 288-7812 and/or email: VRO@ph.lacounty.gov. Visit this link for more information on the registration process: http://www.ph.lacounty.gov/dca/dcabirthhome.htm Note: The child must be registered as soon as possible.

No, the hospital reports the birth information to the Los Angeles County Department of Public Health only. Once registered, you must submit an application and fee to obtain the record. You may order the certificate from this office after 2 months of the child’s birth. If needed sooner, please contact the Los Angeles County Department of Public Health: www.ph.lacounty.gov – 213-288-7812.

No, abstracts are no longer issued and cannot be replaced. You must order an authorized copy of the birth certificate which can be used for all legal purposes. Certificate fees will apply.

There are three ways to order a certified copy of the birth record. You may order by mail, online or in-person. Visit this link for ordering options: https://lavote.gov/home/records/birth-records/birth-records-request/who-can-obtain-a-copy-of-a-birth-record .

Just who issued it. The information and the validity of the certificate are the same.
